elements.text:
rrect(x, y, width, height, [radius], [col]) draws an empty
rectangle with rounded corners.
Parameters in brackets can be omitted.

--draws a red rectangle with rounded edges.
rect(16,16,64,64,10,8)

x
  Top left x coordinate of rectangle.
y
  Top left y coordinate of rectangle.
width
  Width of the rectangle in pixels.
height
  Height of the rectangle in pixels. Extends
  downwards.
radius
  The distance extending from each corner that
  should be rounded. Default is 0.
col
  The color of the rectangle. If omitted, uses
  the last color something was drawn in.

rrectfill() behaves exactly the same as rrect()
and takes the same arguments, except rrectfill()
draws a filled-in rectangle.
